Constructor Detail

Window

public Window()
Creates the gui window that becomes the tictactoe board. Constructor does not take any parameters or returns anything. Once created, the gui will be displayed by the program.

Method Detail

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
This function is called when a button on the game board is clicked. This clicking action, sets off an action listener that records which button was clicked and passes that onto another function to send the response to the server.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
ae -

enableButtons

public void enableButtons()
This function uses the static button array located within this class. For each button, an action listener is created. Once the action listener is enabled, the user can click on a button in the game board and get a response. If that button has already been clicked (has an X or O) then the button is not enables.

disableButtons

public void disableButtons()
This function uses the static button array located within this class. Each button on the game board is disabled so it cannot receive input once clicked by a user.

setGame

public void setGame(Game currGame)
This function is passed the current game object and sets it to the declared object created within this class.

Parameters:
currGame -

setGreeting

public void setGreeting(java.lang.String s)
This function is passed a string from a game object. It is set in the JLabel and the string is displayed on the game board.

Parameters:
s -

buttonChange

public void buttonChange(int move,
                         boolean turn)
This function is responsible for updating the buttons on the game board during the game. It is passed an integer that describes the location of the button within the button array. This specific button is given an action command and icon image depend on whose turn it is (X or O). Once the button has been set, the function validates that the game is not over then updates the players screen.

Parameters:
move -
turn -

validateMove

public void validateMove(int moveMade)
This function checks the status of the tictactoe game after every move. If the integer moveMade equals 1 or 2, then one of the players have won. If moveMade is 3, then there was no winner. Otherwise, the game continues.

Parameters:
moveMade -

winCheck

public int winCheck()
This function loops through every winning combination possible on the game board for the player. If one of the winning combinations matches the current state of the game board, then a 1 is returned, indicating that the game has been won.

Returns:
game state

stalemateCheck

private int stalemateCheck()

sendResponse

private void sendResponse(java.io.OutputStream out,
                          int btnValue)

gameDialog

public static int gameDialog()
This function creates the initial dialog box used to begin the game. Depending on the users response, they will either join a game, create a game, or exit the program. The users response is sent back to the game.

Returns:
the users response
